subject: Re: Should JUnit determine if assert*/fail is called in testFoo?
msgSnippet: ... twice: once ... against a ... Yes, but... Without calling assert* or fail*, the tests always reports success. Joel
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "David Rasch" <rasch@c...> wrote:
>
> > If you want to check that the unittests are correct run them
twice: once
> > against faulty implementation to ensure they all fail; and once
against a
> > correct implementation to ensure they all pass.
>
> In other words, unit test the unit tests.
> David

Yes, but...

Without calling assert* or fail*, the tests always reports success.

Joel
